alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel; McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Laurel, western Knox, southeastern McCreary and Whitley Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 549 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstormd near Heidrick, or over Barbourville, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm area will be near... Emmanuel, Lowell, Bentley Station, Swan Lake and Knoxfork around 555 PM EDT. Dishman Springs, Garrich, Clate and King around 600 PM EDT. Indian Creek, Arkle, Rossland, Bertha Station and Permon around 605 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this area of storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this area of storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
